description: '''Korean ballad''', also known as '''K-ballad''' (often simply referred to by South Koreans as '''ballad'''; {{Korean|hangul=발라드}}), is a style of music in South Korea and a genre in which [[Soul music|soul]] and [[rhythm and blues]] music is transformed to suit Korean sentiment. It became popular in the 1980s, and has influenced and evolved into many different music styles.
